title: 關於周同學  FA有野講

replies.msg:
幫朋友share, 信嘅繼續睇 唔信就上一頁


關於尚德邨跌落樓重傷嘅周同學，我有啲嘢想補充。我係第一批到場嘅自願急救員。

我哋見到周同學嘅時候，有三個消防員同佢做緊急救。呢個時候，佢已經無咗意識、失禁、而且不斷嘔血。

佢全程都係無意識。一開始仲可以發出一啲聲音，同有一啲無意識嘅踢腿動作。對一啲「痛」亦會作出反應。當時嘅情況已經好危急，係好需要救護車，但一直無車到。

喺我哋做緊嘢嘅時候，無啦啦有幾個警察行埋嚟，用槍指住我哋，叫我哋走。

喺現場，除咗消防同救護，記者得一個。街坊亦都無。我哋全部人都喺度搶救緊呢個姓周嘅同學。全部人都有著反光衣，但係啲警察要我哋走。好彩啲消防員幫我哋擋住。咁啲警察嘈咗一輪之後，就走咗嘞。

過咗五分鐘之後，周同學嘅情況開始惡化。全身開始痙攣，完全郁唔到。剪開佢件衫之後，明顯見到有骨折變形、有腫塊。我哋現場嘅人員完全無裝備去處理呢個情況。

有個急救嘅隊友落咗樓帶救護車上嚟，但好耐都見唔到佢。跟住佢嘅脈搏開始跌、一路跌。跌到落 60，之後幾十秒之後，就跌到最低 41。呢個時候，佢連聲都出唔到，瞳孔反射都好慢。情況真係好危急！

但係樓下啲警察阻住，唔畀救護車過。落咗樓嘅 FA，跑到氣都斷，警察都係唔畀救護車過。

我哋真係好無助，手頭咩都無，幫唔到佢。救護車要差唔多喺受傷後嘅半個鐘頭後先上到嚟接手。消防同我哋幾個都攰到攤咗喺地下到。

由救護嚟到，到周同學上車，我哋全程都無講過嘢。氣氛真係好沉重。

如果唔係警察阻住救護，可能佢可以提早三十分鐘上車。早三十分鐘做手術。如果唔係警察阻住救護車，樓下嘅手足就唔洗以卵擊石，犧牲自己。

望住佢咁痛苦，我嘅心情不將惡化。我哋亦都做唔到嘢去幫佢。呢種感覺，真係好難形容。而家只要一合埋眼，我就見到我手套上有佢嘅血。周圍無聲嘅時候，我就會聽到佢痛苦嘅呻吟。

我全程都握住佢隻手，一開始佢仲識得捉住我。但到後來，佢嘅心跳變得慢。佢隻手慢慢鬆開。呢種感覺真係好難形容。

個心好似插咗把刀咁痛，好內疚。點解我做唔到多啲嘢幫佢？我哋圍住佢真係束手無策。可以做嘅嘢都做曬，除咗握住佢隻手，我哋真係無其他嘢可以做。

我唔知點解佢要冒咁大嘅險要跳落嚟。但係我知道佢跳落嚟嗰下一定係好驚好驚。我真係好心痛，我都唔明點解警察連開條路畀救護車都唔肯。

我唔相信，明明有警察見過周同學，樓下啲警察會唔知到呢到有個嚴重嘅傷者。

有個急救嘅隊友落咗樓帶救護車上嚟，但好耐都見唔到佢。跟住佢嘅脈搏開始跌、一路跌。跌到落 60，之後幾十秒之後，就跌到最低 41。呢個時候，佢連聲都出唔到，瞳孔反射都好慢。情況真係好危急！

但係樓下啲警察阻住，唔畀救護車過。落咗樓嘅 FA，跑到氣都斷，警察都係唔畀救護車過。

我哋真係好無助，手頭咩都無，幫唔到佢。救護車要差唔多喺受傷後嘅半個鐘頭後先上到嚟接手。消防同我哋幾個都攰到攤咗喺地下到。

由救護嚟到，到周同學上車，我哋全程都無講過嘢。氣氛真係好沉重。

如果唔係警察阻住救護，可能佢可以提早三十分鐘上車。早三十分鐘做手術。如果唔係警察阻住救護車，樓下嘅手足就唔洗以卵擊石，犧牲自己。

望住佢咁痛苦，我嘅心情不將惡化。我哋亦都做唔到嘢去幫佢。呢種感覺，真係好難形容。而家只要一合埋眼，我就見到我手套上有佢嘅血。周圍無聲嘅時候，我就會聽到佢痛苦嘅呻吟。

我全程都握住佢隻手，一開始佢仲識得捉住我。但到後來，佢嘅心跳變得慢。佢隻手慢慢鬆開。呢種感覺真係好難形容。

個心好似插咗把刀咁痛，好內疚。點解我做唔到多啲嘢幫佢？我哋圍住佢真係束手無策。可以做嘅嘢都做曬，除咗握住佢隻手，我哋真係無其他嘢可以做。

我唔知點解佢要冒咁大嘅險要跳落嚟。但係我知道佢跳落嚟嗰下一定係好驚好驚。我真係好心痛，我都唔明點解警察連開條路畀救護車都唔肯。

我唔相信，明明有警察見過周同學，樓下啲警察會唔知到呢到有個嚴重嘅傷者。

阻礙救援同蓄意謀殺無分別。

阻礙救援等於蓄意謀殺。

關於尚德邨跌落樓重傷嘅周同學，我有啲嘢想補充。我係第一批到場嘅自願急救員。

我哋見到周同學嘅時候，有三個消防員同佢做緊急救。呢個時候，佢已經無咗意識、失禁、而且不斷嘔血。

佢全程都係無意識。一開始仲可以發出一啲聲音，同有一啲無意識嘅踢腿動作。對一啲「痛」亦會作出反應。當時嘅情況已經好危急，係好需要救護車，但一直無車到。

喺我哋做緊嘢嘅時候，無啦啦有幾個警察行埋嚟，用槍指住我哋，叫我哋走。

喺現場，除咗消防同救護，記者得一個。街坊亦都無。我哋全部人都喺度搶救緊呢個姓周嘅同學。全部人都有著反光衣，但係啲警察要我哋走。好彩啲消防員幫我哋擋住。咁啲警察嘈咗一輪之後，就走咗嘞。

過咗五分鐘之後，周同學嘅情況開始惡化。全身開始痙攣，完全郁唔到。剪開佢件衫之後，明顯見到有骨折變形、有腫塊。我哋現場嘅人員完全無裝備去處理呢個情況。

有個急救嘅隊友落咗樓帶救護車上嚟，但好耐都見唔到佢。跟住佢嘅脈搏開始跌、一路跌。跌到落 60，之後幾十秒之後，就跌到最低 41。呢個時候，佢連聲都出唔到，瞳孔反射都好慢。情況真係好危急！

但係樓下啲警察阻住，唔畀救護車過。落咗樓嘅 FA，跑到氣都斷，警察都係唔畀救護車過。

我哋真係好無助，手頭咩都無，幫唔到佢。救護車要差唔多喺受傷後嘅半個鐘頭後先上到嚟接手。消防同我哋幾個都攰到攤咗喺地下到。

由救護嚟到，到周同學上車，我哋全程都無講過嘢。氣氛真係好沉重。

如果唔係警察阻住救護，可能佢可以提早三十分鐘上車。早三十分鐘做手術。如果唔係警察阻住救護車，樓下嘅手足就唔洗以卵擊石，犧牲自己。

望住佢咁痛苦，我嘅心情不將惡化。我哋亦都做唔到嘢去幫佢。呢種感覺，真係好難形容。而家只要一合埋眼，我就見到我手套上有佢嘅血。周圍無聲嘅時候，我就會聽到佢痛苦嘅呻吟。

我全程都握住佢隻手，一開始佢仲識得捉住我。但到後來，佢嘅心跳變得慢。佢隻手慢慢鬆開。呢種感覺真係好難形容。

個心好似插咗把刀咁痛，好內疚。點解我做唔到多啲嘢幫佢？我哋圍住佢真係束手無策。可以做嘅嘢都做曬，除咗握住佢隻手，我哋真係無其他嘢可以做。

我唔知點解佢要冒咁大嘅險要跳落嚟。但係我知道佢跳落嚟嗰下一定係好驚好驚。我真係好心痛，我都唔明點解警察連開條路畀救護車都唔肯。

我唔相信，明明有警察見過周同學，樓下啲警察會唔知到呢到有個嚴重嘅傷者。

阻礙救援同蓄意謀殺無分別。

阻礙救援等於蓄意謀殺。

封信譯咗英文，有錯請改，要話畀全世界知！

Hello. I have something to add about the incident which happened this morning where a student surnamed Chow fell from a car park in Sheung Tak Estate.

I was among the first batch of first aiders who arrived at the scene. We saw three firemen were giving Chow first aid at that time, and he had already lost consciousness and the ability to control his excretion and he was constantly vomiting blood.

He was unconscious throughout the episode. At the beginning, he still managed to make some sound and kick his foot either consciously or unconsciously and would react to pain. He was in critical condition at that time and an ambulance was desperately needed to transport him to hospital.

But the ambulance wouldn’t come. In the meantime, a few cops walked over from nowhere and pointed guns at us, telling us to leave. There were only firemen and first aiders and only one journalist at the scene, and not a single resident in sight. We were all helping Chow, and we all had reflective vests on us. But the cops still told us to leave. Fortunately, the firemen didn’t back down and the cops left after making a fuss for a while.

About five minutes later, Chow’s condition began to deteriorate. His whole body started to cramp, and he was completely unable to move. We cut open his shirt and saw his rib bones were obviously deformed and we could see there were lumps.

We didn’t have any equipment with us to deal with his condition. A first aid teammate rushed downstairs to wait for the ambulance. But still no ambulance in sight.

Then Chow’s pulse started to fall. At first, his pulse was stable at around 60, but then dropped to as low as 41 within a minute. At that point he wasn’t able to make any sound. Reflex of his pupils became very slow. He was in a very critical condition.

But the cops downstairs were blocking the road and wouldn’t allow the ambulance to make its way through. The first aid teammate rushed downstairs but the cops still wouldn’t allow the ambulance to pass through. We were very helpless. We had no equipment and couldn’t help him. The ambulance couldn’t come. We were extremely helpless.

The paramedics finally came after more than half an hour from the time he was injured. The firemen and we were all exhausted. Atmosphere was grim throughout the time when the paramedics came to the time Chow was being moved to the ambulance.

Chow would have been moved to the ambulance and received medical surgery 30 minutes earlier if the cops weren’t there blocking the road, and the teammate downstairs wouldn’t have to sacrifice himself by confronting the cops alone.

Seeing him in agony and his condition deteriorating continuously, and all the while we could do nothing to help him, this feeling is hard to describe. Now when I close my eyes, I would see his blood on my gloves; and when it’s silent, I would hear his moaning.

I held his hand throughout the whole process. At the beginning he was still able to grip my hand. Later when his heartbeat slowed down, his grip gradually loosened. It’s hard to describe that moment. My heart ached like it was stabbed with a knife. I felt guilty, why couldn’t I do more to help him. There was nothing much we could do when we surrounded him, and we’d done everything we could. There were no other things we could do except holding his hand. We were very helpless.

I don’t know what made him risked his life to jump down. But I know he must be very frightened when he jumped down.

My heart aches when I think of him. I don’t understand why the cops weren’t even willing to just let the ambulance pass through. I don’t believe that the cops downstairs didn’t know that someone was injured after a whole team of cops had walked passed the scene.

Obstructing medical aid is no different from willful murder.

Seeing him in agony and his condition deteriorating continuously, and all the while we could do nothing to help him, this feeling is hard to describe. Now when I close my eyes, I would see his blood on my gloves; and when it’s silent, I would hear his moaning.

I held his hand throughout the whole process. At the beginning he was still able to grip my hand. Later when his heartbeat slowed down, his grip gradually loosened. It’s hard to describe that moment. My heart ached like it was stabbed with a knife. I felt guilty, why couldn’t I do more to help him. There was nothing much we could do when we surrounded him, and we’d done everything we could. There were no other things we could do except holding his hand. We were very helpless.

I don’t know what made him risked his life to jump down. But I know he must be very frightened when he jumped down.

My heart aches when I think of him. I don’t understand why the cops weren’t even willing to just let the ambulance pass through. I don’t believe that the cops downstairs didn’t know that someone was injured after a whole team of cops had walked passed the scene.

Obstructing medical aid is no different from willful murder.
